clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed and low disease activity receive MTX monotherapy or an alternative csDMARD monotherapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and low disease activity
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 4 months; assessed with: ACR 20)

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population with moderate to high disease activity.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed and low disease activity receive MTX monotherapy or an alternative csDMARD monotherapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and low disease activity
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 4 months; assessed with: DAS28-ESR (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -1.17)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of blinding of patients, personnel, and outcome assessors.

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population with moderate to high disease activity.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting no effect. Small sample size.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio
